name: Pleurothallis rubella
description: Pleurothallis rubella is an epiphytic orchid native to cloud forests of Central and South America, particularly Costa Rica, Panama, and Colombia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features upright stems (5-10 cm tall) with small, dramatic, lance-shaped, dark green leaves and distinctive small red flowers. The plant displays an upright growth habit. Native to cloud forests or montane regions, this plant is adapted to cool, humid conditions with constant mist and moderate temperatures. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in cloud forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest to any environment. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its compact size and red flowers.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
